text:
<start_of_turn>user
translate this sentence in docker command: Give me a list of containers that have the Ubuntu image as their ancestor.<end_of_turn>
<start_of_turn>model
COMMAND: docker ps --filter 'ancestor=ubuntu'<end_of_turn><|end_of_text|>

<start_of_turn>user
translate this sentence in docker command: Fetch the containers that have exited with a status code of 1.<end_of_turn>
<start_of_turn>model
COMMAND: docker ps -a --filter 'status=exited' --filter 'exited=1'<end_of_turn><|end_of_text|>

<start_of_turn>user
translate this sentence in docker command: Provide a comprehensive list of nginx images, including their repository, tag, and ID.<end_of_turn>
<start_of_turn>model
COMMAND: docker images nginx --format "{{.Repository}},{{.Tag}},{{.ID}}"<end_of_turn><|end_of_text|>

<start_of_turn>user
translate this sentence in docker command: Give me a list of all containers, indicating their status as well. <end_of_turn>
<start_of_turn>model
COMMAND: docker ps -a<end_of_turn><|end_of_text|>

<start_of_turn>user
translate this sentence in docker command: List all containers with Ubuntu as their ancestor.<end_of_turn>
<start_of_turn>model
COMMAND: docker ps --filter 'ancestor=ubuntu'<end_of_turn><|end_of_text|>

<start_of_turn>user
translate this sentence in docker command: "Dear Docker, in order to proceed, you must log in to the new registry on newregistry.example.org. Use your username, Mary Doe, to log in."<end_of_turn>
<start_of_turn>model
COMMAND: "docker login newregistry.example.org --username=marydoe"<end_of_turn><|end_of_text|>

<start_of_turn>user
translate this sentence in docker command: Docker, please show me the containers with exited status.<end_of_turn>
<start_of_turn>model
COMMAND: docker ps -a --filter 'status=exited'<end_of_turn><|end_of_text|>

<start_of_turn>user
translate this sentence in docker command: Please stop all containers that are currently operational.<end_of_turn>
<start_of_turn>model
COMMAND: "docker stop $(docker ps -q --filter status=running)"<end_of_turn><|end_of_text|>

<start_of_turn>user
translate this sentence in docker command: I want to see the running containers with the ACME label from the vendor ACME.<end_of_turn>
<start_of_turn>model
COMMAND: docker ps -a --filter 'label=com.example.vendor=ACME' --filter 'status=running'<end_of_turn><|end_of_text|>

<start_of_turn>user
translate this sentence in docker command: Please show me a table of images, including the repository, tag, ID, and size.<end_of_turn>
<start_of_turn>model
COMMAND: docker images --format "table {{.Repository}},{{.Tag}},{{.ID}},{{.Size}}"<end_of_turn><|end_of_text|>

<start_of_turn>user
translate this sentence in docker command: I want to see a list of all Docker images, including the dangling ones. Could you please provide their repository, tags, and IDs as well?<end_of_turn>
<start_of_turn>model
COMMAND: docker images -a --format "{{.Repository}},{{.Tag}},{{.ID}}"<end_of_turn><|end_of_text|>

<start_of_turn>user
translate this sentence in docker command: Docker, display the running containers rooted from Debian.<end_of_turn>
<start_of_turn>model
COMMAND: docker ps --filter 'status=running' --filter 'ancestor=debian'<end_of_turn><|end_of_text|>

<start_of_turn>user
translate this sentence in docker command: Politely stop my_container by sending the SIGINT signal, Docker.<end_of_turn>
<start_of_turn>model
COMMAND: "docker kill -s SIGINT my_container"<end_of_turn><|end_of_text|>

<start_of_turn>user
translate this sentence in docker command: Present all the images without any truncation of their details.<end_of_turn>
<start_of_turn>model
COMMAND: docker images --no-trunc<end_of_turn><|end_of_text|>

<start_of_turn>user
translate this sentence in docker command: Retrieve the tasks that are running in Docker.<end_of_turn>
<start_of_turn>model
COMMAND: docker ps --filter 'is-task=true'<end_of_turn><|end_of_text|>

<start_of_turn>user
translate this sentence in docker command: Please show me the containers with the name "my-container", please. <end_of_turn>
<start_of_turn>model
COMMAND: docker ps --filter 'name=my-container'<end_of_turn><|end_of_text|>

<start_of_turn>user
translate this sentence in docker command: I want to know the status of all containers, whether running or stopped. <end_of_turn>
<start_of_turn>model
COMMAND: docker ps -a<end_of_turn><|end_of_text|>

<start_of_turn>user
translate this sentence in docker command: Attach the container "my_container" to the "my_network" network.<end_of_turn>
<start_of_turn>model
COMMAND: "docker login --username=marydoe --password-stdin < ~/herpassword.txt"<end_of_turn><|end_of_text|>

<start_of_turn>user
translate this sentence in docker command: Give me the Docker images that were built before the image "nginx:latest".<end_of_turn>
<start_of_turn>model
COMMAND: docker images -f before=nginx:latest<end_of_turn><|end_of_text|>

<start_of_turn>user
translate this sentence in docker command: I need you to list the repositories and tags of your images.<end_of_turn>
<start_of_turn>model
COMMAND: docker images --format "{{.Repository}},{{.Tag}}"<end_of_turn><|end_of_text|>

<start_of_turn>user
translate this sentence in docker command: Provide me with the repository, tag, and digest information of the images.<end_of_turn>
<start_of_turn>model
COMMAND: docker images --digests --format "{{.Repository}},{{.Tag}},{{.Digest}}"<end_of_turn><|end_of_text|>

<start_of_turn>user
translate this sentence in docker command: You should login to the new registry with your username and password.<end_of_turn>
<start_of_turn>model
COMMAND: "docker login newregistry.example.org --username=marydoe --password=herpassword"<end_of_turn><|end_of_text|>

<start_of_turn>user
translate this sentence in docker command: Kindly provide your username and password from the specified file to login.<end_of_turn>
<start_of_turn>model
COMMAND: "docker login --username=johndoe --password-stdin < ~/mypassword.txt"<end_of_turn><|end_of_text|>

<start_of_turn>user
translate this sentence in docker command: Please display the containers with a healthy health status.<end_of_turn>
<start_of_turn>model
COMMAND: docker ps --filter 'health=healthy'<end_of_turn><|end_of_text|>

<start_of_turn>user
translate this sentence in docker command: Give me a list of all containers that exited before the container with ID 4f66ad9a0b2e.<end_of_turn>
<start_of_turn>model
COMMAND: docker ps -a --filter 'before=4f66ad9a0b2e' --filter 'status=exited'<end_of_turn><|end_of_text|>

<start_of_turn>user
translate this sentence in docker command: Get the names, images, and status of the containers for me.<end_of_turn>
<start_of_turn>model
COMMAND: docker ps --format '{{.Names}}\t{{.Image}}\t{{.Status}}'<end_of_turn><|end_of_text|>

<start_of_turn>user
translate this sentence in docker command: Let me know the current status and sizes of the running containers.  <end_of_turn>
<start_of_turn>model
COMMAND: docker ps -s<end_of_turn><|end_of_text|>

<start_of_turn>user
translate this sentence in docker command: Please show me the Docker containers that have exited and are related to the nginx image.<end_of_turn>

translate this sentence in docker command: Give me a list of images along with their repository, tag and ID.<end_of_turn>

<start_of_turn>user
translate this sentence in docker command: I need the complete details of all the currently running containers.<end_of_turn>

COMMAND: docker ps --no-trunc<end_of_turn><|end_of_text|>

<start_of_turn>user
translate this sentence in docker command: Please show me the tasks currently running in Docker.<end_of_turn>

COMMAND: docker ps --filter 'is-task=true'<end_of_turn><|end_of_text|>
